info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 6:05PM CST until March 12 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches, except locally two to four inches in the Pennyrile region of western Kentucky, from Central City to Hopkinsville and Cadiz. * WHERE...This advisory is generally along and southeast of a line from New Madrid Missouri, to Paducah Kentucky, to Evansville Indiana. * WHEN...Through 6 AM Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially on bridges. Travelers should prepare for worsening road conditions tonight and allow extra time to reach your destination. Visibilities may drop significantly to one half mile due to the snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest concern for high snowfall rates up to one half inch per hour will be through 1 AM Saturday morning. With cooling ground and road surfaces, slippery conditions will develop through the night. Wind chills will fall into the single digits above zero by morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
